intro: Parosela hofstenii, commonly known as the Hofsten's parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial herb that produces small, narrow leaves and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
